intro: Boechera languida, commonly known as the slender rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The species is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, white or pale yellow flowers clustered in racemes. Its leaves are typically narrow and linear, adapted to thrive in rocky or sandy soils. Boechera languida is often found in alpine or arid environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
